channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HIVE-12257] Enhance ORC FileDump utility to handle flush_length files and recovery
item.description: ORC file dump utility currently does not handle delta directories that contain *_flush_length files. These files contains offsets to footer in the corresponding delta file.
item.summary: Enhance ORC FileDump utility to handle flush_length files and recovery

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Eugene Koifman Can you take a look at this patch?

I think FileDump.printData()
should include e.getMessage() in System.err.println("Unable to dump data for file: " + file);

I think getReaderInfo(final Configuration conf, final Path sideFile, final Path path) implementation may be unreliable.
See OrcRawRecordMerger.getLastFlushLength.
Instead of relying on NN metadata for length, it has a while loop. This (I believe) is to make sure to read until EOF even if NN doesn't yet have the latest info.

(I guess ReaderImpl.extractMetaInfoFromFooter can't use the same trick since that would be a perf problem)

Thanks for the review comments. In the next version of patch which I am yet to complete, I am using the file length to only if the file is closed at which point what NN reports will be correct. In other cases I am already using OrcRawRecordMerger.getLastFlushLength.

Will include you other comments in the next patch.

ATTACHMENT ID: 12770729 - PreCommit-HIVE-TRUNK-Build
Sorry for the recent modifications. All changes were intended for HIVE-12349.

The latest patch still uses ObjectInspectors for empty bucket creation. With HIVE-4243, we are moving away from OI and using TypeDescription instead. Currently using empty struct type description throws NPE. Will address it in a separate patch.
To remove ObjectInpsectors from FileDump we need HIVE-12054 that addresses the NPE issue.
